tiled.core
Class TileSet

java.lang.Object
  tiled.core.TileSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Tile>
public class TileSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Tile>

todo: Update documentation

TileSet handles operations on tiles as a set, or group. It has several advanced internal functions aimed at reducing unnecessary data replication. A 'tile' is represented internally as two distinct pieces of data. The first and most important is a Tile object, and these are held in a Vector.

The other is the tile image.

                              TileCutter cutter)
Creates a tileset from a buffered image. Tiles are cut by the passed cutter.

Parameters:

setSource

public void setSource(java.lang.String source)
Sets the URI path of the external source of this tile set. By setting this, the set is implied to be external in all other operations.

Parameters:
source - a URI of the tileset image file

addNewTile

public void addNewTile(Tile t)
This method takes a new Tile object as argument, and in addition to the functionality of addTile(), sets the id of the tile to -1.

Parameters:
t - the new tile to add.
See Also:
addTile(Tile)

removeTile

public void removeTile(int i)
Removes a tile from this tileset. Does not invalidate other tile indices. Removal is simply setting the reference at the specified index to null.

Parameters:
i - the index to remove

size

public int size()
Returns the amount of tiles in this tileset.

Returns:
the amount of tiles in this tileset

getMaxTileId

public int getMaxTileId()
Returns the maximum tile id.

Returns:
the maximum tile id, or -1 when there are no tiles

iterator

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Tile>

getTileWidth

public int getTileWidth()
Returns the width of tiles in this tileset. All tiles in a tileset should be the same width, and the same as the tile width of the map the tileset is used with.

Returns:
int - The maximum tile width

getTileHeight

public int getTileHeight()
Returns the tile height of tiles in this tileset. Not all tiles in a tileset are required to have the same height, but the height should be at least the tile height of the map the tileset is used with. If there are tiles with varying heights in this tileset, the returned height will be the maximum.

Returns:
the max height of the tiles in the set

getTileSpacing

public int getTileSpacing()
Returns the spacing between the tiles on the tileset image.

Returns:
the spacing in pixels between the tiles on the tileset image

getTileMargin

public int getTileMargin()
Returns the margin around the tiles on the tileset image.

Returns:
the margin in pixels around the tiles on the tileset image

getTilesPerRow

public int getTilesPerRow()
Returns the number of tiles per row in the original tileset image.

Returns:
the number of tiles per row in the original tileset image.

getTile

public Tile getTile(int i)
Gets the tile with local id i.

Parameters:
i - local id of tile
Returns:
A tile with local id i or null if no tile exists with that id

getFirstTile

public Tile getFirstTile()
Returns the first non-null tile in the set.

Returns:
The first tile in this tileset, or null if none exists.

getSource

public java.lang.String getSource()
Returns the source of this tileset.

Returns:
a filename if tileset is external or null if tileset is internal.

getBaseDir

public java.lang.String getBaseDir()
Returns the base directory for the tileset

Returns:
a directory in native format as given in the tileset file or tag
